answerText: MO or molecular orbital theory[10] These molecular orbitals, denoted by a star, are created when a pair of atomic orbitals overlaps out-of-phase, creating a higher-energy state. Electrons occupying these orbitals are subtracted when finding bond order.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 15 | 16 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Drawing a diagram of these entities for benzene allows for a derivation of Huckel's rule. For 10 points each: [10] Identify these constructs, which arise out of the linear combination of atomic orbitals. These are mathematical regions in a multi-atom system in which electrons tend to hang out.
